snippet: FIFA, a self-regulated body that has been slow to heed calls for reform, has had some meaningful changes to its leadership since awarding the 2022 World Cup to Qatar.
abstract: FIFA's controversial decision to award 2022 soccer World Cup to Qatar, and resulting scrutiny, has produced some of the most meaningful changes in decades to secretive and insular organization; number of longtime executives have been replaced by fresh staff with a new willingness to address governance issues.
lead_paragraph: FIFA, a self-regulated body that has been slow to heed calls for reform, has had some meaningful changes to its leadership since awarding the 2022 World Cup to Qatar.

headline.main: Changes Slowly Coming to FIFA as Problems Put It on the Defensive
headline.print_headline: Changes Slowly Coming To FIFA as Problems Put It on the Defensive
